author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Cross-border Capital Flows and the Role of the IMF and Central Banks in the Evolving International Monetary System
Key quote: Drawing lessons from this traumatic experience, Asian central banks and the IMF have both taken a variety of actions to deal with capital flows and prevent a financial crisis.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the benefits and risks of cross-border capital flows and the resilience of Asia to capital flow disruptions. While it recognizes the risks of geopolitical tensions, it also highlights the stability and improved frameworks in place. The balancing of risks and stability results in a neutral stance, suggesting no immediate urgency to change the policy rate.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Opportunities and Challenges for Financial Intermediation Functions Brought about by Technological Advancements
Key quote: It is necessary to keep in mind, however, that technological advancements bring new risks to financial stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the impact of technological advancements on the financial industry, without direct references to current monetary policy or the economic outlook that would influence interest rate decisions. Thus, the content is not directly related to monetary policy decision-making.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Remarks on the Introduction of a New Series of Bank of Japan Notes
Key quote: Today, the Bank is planning to send off the new series of Bank of Japan notes with a total value of 1.6 trillion yen to the public.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the issuance of new currency notes and does not discuss monetary policy or give any indications about future interest rate decisions.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: Progress and Challenges in the Asia-Pacific Financial System
Key quote: The current stability of the APAC financial system results from continuous efforts by relevant stakeholders, drawing from the lessons and experiences of past crises.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial system stability, digitalization, and climate change rather than discussing specific monetary policy stances or intentions related to interest rates.

author: Kazuo Ueda
title: What to Know about Central Bank Digital Currency
Key quote: Today I will be talking about Central Bank Digital Currency, often abbreviated as CBDC.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the topic of Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC) and does not directly address current monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Shinichi Uchida
title: The Bank of Japan from the Perspective of Business Operations
Key quote: I will leave aside the question of how interest rates will unfold because that would take us away from the topic of my speech today.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the operational aspects of the Bank of Japan and not directly about monetary policy stances or future policy direction. Therefore, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy specifically.

author: Shinichi Uchida
title: Challenges to the Financial System during and after the Pandemic and a Way Forward
Key quote: In an effort to contain this high inflation, many central banks started to raise policy interest rates at an unprecedented pace.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial stability and lessons from the pandemic, with historical observations rather than direct implications for immediate monetary policy changes. The central bank's current stance is likely to remain cautious, thus suggesting a hold on rates.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Evolution of payments - payment systems for "Neoteric Individuals"
Key quote: Ensuring the coexistence of CBDC with various other forms of money, and upon doing so, providing in collaboration with the private sector a payment instrument in digital form that is safe and usable anywhere, anytime - this is something that we need to and will in fact achieve in the future.
Rationale: The speech by Haruhiko Kuroda focuses on the evolution of payment systems and technologies rather than on monetary policy or interest rate changes. Hence, it is not directly related to central bank policy shifts.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Keynote speech - ASEAN+3 Economic Cooperation and Financial Stability Forum
Key quote: Central banks are projected to continue tightening their monetary policies for the time being, such as by reducing monetary accommodation.
Rationale: Kuroda acknowledges global inflationary pressures and central banks tightening monetary policy, but anticipates a moderate global growth with inflation rates gradually declining. The speech does not imply a shift towards more accommodative or tighter policy in Japan, suggesting a 'Hold'.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Sustainable finance - entering a new phase of implementation
Key quote: The Bank of Japan will continue to work together with financial institutions and market participants, and thereby strongly support initiatives to address climate change.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Haruhiko Kuroda focuses on sustainable finance and climate change rather than monetary policy. The context of sustainable finance and its frameworks does not inherently indicate a dovish or hawkish stance on monetary policy. Consequently, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy. Given the non-monetary focus, while still acknowledging the existing low policy rate, the most probable prediction is to 'Hold' rates with an understanding of the broader macroeconomic climate in Japan.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Digitalization - financial services for society
Key quote: Today, I would like to talk about the role that digitalization will play in enabling more people to receive financial services that fit their livelihoods.
Rationale: The speech focuses on digitalization and financial services, not directly addressing monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Role of finance in addressing climate change - three essential elements
Key quote: Addressing climate change should not be considered as a cost or a constraint on economic growth.
Rationale: The speech focuses on sustainable finance and climate change, and does not address traditional monetary policy concerns such as interest rates, inflation, or employment directly.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: The Bank of Japan's strategy on climate change
Key quote: Today, I would like to talk about climate change.
Rationale: While the speech discusses the intersection of climate change and central bank policy, it is primarily focused on the Bank of Japan's strategy addressing climate change rather than explicit monetary policy decisions. No direct implications for changing the policy rate were made; thus, it is categorized as not directly related to monetary policy.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Opening remarks - 2021 BOJ-IMES Conference
Key quote: Looking to the future, the challenges facing policymakers will likely change.
Rationale: Governor Kuroda discusses the challenges and transformations facing the economy due to the pandemic, emphasizing collaboration between fiscal and monetary policies without suggesting imminent changes to interest rates. This indicates a neutral stance towards monetary policy, likely leading to a hold decision at the next meeting.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Addressing climate-related financial risks -- from a central bank's perspective
Key quote: Climate change is having a significant effect on central banks' policy management.
Rationale: The speech by Governor Kuroda primarily addresses climate-related financial risks and the role of the Bank of Japan in managing these risks. It does not focus on monetary policy or provide insights into potential changes in interest rates.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Integrating information and financial systems- beyond as-a-service
Key quote: Central banks share the view that it is not an appropriate policy response to start considering CBDC only when the need to issue CBDC arises in the future.
Rationale: The speech does not address current monetary policy direction or rate decisions but rather focuses on fintech and digital transformation in finance, making it not directly related to monetary policy.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: A perspective on the future of Asia
Key quote: Asia is one of the regions that has benefited most from post-war financial and economic globalization.
Rationale: The speech by Haruhiko Kuroda primarily discusses the future economic and geopolitical challenges and opportunities for Asia, rather than addressing monetary policy or central banking concerns. It focuses on regional integration, global leadership, and economic collaboration in Asia.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Payments innovations and the role of central banks - addressing challenges posed by stablecoins
Key quote: While GSCs have the potential to improve payment services, their widespread use and the increase in GSC-denominated transactions could undermine the effects of monetary policy transmission and financial system stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on payment innovations and the role of central banks, particularly regarding stablecoins, without a direct discussion on monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: International financial regulation and supervision - past achievements, current issues, and future agendas
Key quote: In my speech today I have mentioned climate-related risk as a new issue in considering financial stability.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses global financial regulation, market fragmentation, and climate-related financial risks, which are more connected to financial stability and regulation rather than monetary policy directly. Thus, it doesn't offer clear guidance on interest rate actions such as a cut or raise.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: For sustainable development of emerging economies
Key quote: The situation surrounding emerging economies has been changing rapidly. The global economy has recently been slowing down and there are various downside risks, ranging from trade tensions to geopolitical risks.
Rationale: The speech focuses on sustainable development, financial inclusion, and demographic trends in emerging economies rather than directly addressing monetary policy or providing indications about future interest rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Integrating finance and technology for new growth opportunities
Key quote: The Bank will continue to make efforts so that better financial services and the creation of new businesses will lead to economic growth.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the integration of FinTech and finance for growth opportunities, with no direct references to monetary policy or interest rate changes.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Thirty years of Bank of Italy in Japan
Key quote: I am honored to be here today for the 30th Anniversary of the Banca d'Italia Representative Office in Tokyo.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the historical and diplomatic relationship between Banca d'Italia and the Bank of Japan, without detailed discussion of current monetary policy. However, a brief mention is made of Japan's economic state, suggesting a stable policy stance.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Our future in the digital age
Key quote: Today, we discussed two topics on the theme of 'Our Future in the Digital Age.'
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial innovation and technology's impact on the financial system rather than on monetary policy or interest rate changes.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Financial inclusion in an aging society
Key quote: In light of these changes and challenges, the Bank of Japan is working to support the development of sound financial services by, for example, improving financial literacy through the activities of the CCFSI, and promoting fintech, so that everyone can use financial services with confidence, even in an aging society.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on financial inclusion and the challenges posed by an aging society in Japan. It does not address monetary policy, interest rates, or inflation, which are typically discussed in a central banker's speech related to monetary policy.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: How finance and ICT combine - a historical view on the future
Key quote: I see our current evolution in ICT as having strong potential to magnify both the opportunities and the risks of finance.
Rationale: The speech mainly focuses on the interaction between finance and information and communication technology (ICT) throughout history rather than direct monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Global economy - challenges and policy responses
Key quote: However, there remains a high degree of uncertainty regarding these prospects, and the downside risks are large.
Rationale: The speech focuses on global economic challenges and highlights a balanced view of potential recovery and risks. While there are discussions of risks, such as trade tensions, and cautious optimism about potential recovery, there is no clear message advocating for changes in monetary policy, aligning with a neutral stance.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Toward inclusive and sustainable development
Key quote: The Bank of Japan would like to contribute through taking initiatives toward the healthy development of FinTech, supporting financial institutions which contribute to regional vitalization, promoting financial literacy, as well as securing economic, price, and financial stability.
Rationale: The speech focused on sustainable development, financial inclusion, and the role of technology in tackling global issues. It did not address monetary policy or provide insight into future interest rate changes.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Opening remarks - G20 Finance and Central Bank Deputies Meeting
Key quote: Many issues must be considered in our efforts to cope with an aging society, including fiscal, monetary, and structural policies.
Rationale: The speech mainly covers global cooperation and policy discussions related to aging societies and inclusivity, not specific to immediate monetary policy actions or rate guidance.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Demographic changes and challenges for financial sector
Key quote: NA
Rationale: While the speech touches on financial sector implications of demographic changes, it does not directly address monetary policy or imply a stance on interest rate changes.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Post-crisis futures markets
Key quote: The Bank of Japan obtains information from futures markets that is valuable in understanding the markets' views and sentiment toward the economy and corporate performance.
Rationale: The speech primarily addresses the functioning and trends of futures markets, technological innovations, and financial regulations, rather than directly discussing monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Central banking in a changing world
Key quote: Central banks are facing new challenges both in terms of policies and operations as a result of wide-ranging structural changes in the global economic and financial environment.
Rationale: While Kuroda discusses the challenges central banks face due to global structural changes, he does not suggest any immediate changes to policy, indicating a balanced view. This suggests a neutral stance, likely opting to hold rates steady while assessing the impact of these changes.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Innovation and the future of finance
Key quote: The Bank of Japan is actively promoting FinTech from the standpoint of a central bank.
Rationale: The speech focuses primarily on innovation in finance and FinTech, rather than on specific monetary policy measures or economic conditions that would suggest a shift in interest rate policy. Consequently, it does not warrant a categorization related to hawkish or dovish monetary policy.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Asian financial markets - 20 y since the Asian Financial Crisis, and prospects for the next 20 years
Key quote: Looking ahead to the next twenty years, Asia's economy will continue to be at the core of world economic growth and we will experience further integration.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the development of financial markets in Asia and the resilience of the region, rather than monetary policy or interest rate changes. Therefore, it is not directly related to monetary policy decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Theory on financial markets and central banks
Key quote: In relation to this point, since September 2016, the Bank has implemented yield curve control, in which it sets the short-term policy interest rate at minus 0.1 percent, and purchases JGBs so that 10-year JGB yields remain at around 0 percent.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the theoretical and practical aspects of financial markets and central banks' roles without indicating any immediate change in monetary policy stance. Governor Kuroda describes current policies like yield curve control but does not suggest further easing or tightening, implying a neutral stance.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: The virtues of international cooperation among central banks
Key quote: In this situation, international cooperation among central banks has become ever more important.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on international cooperation between central banks and does not discuss current monetary policy or interest rate decisions, so it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy. However, the idea of cooperation suggests stability, leading to a 'Hold' prediction.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Toward inclusive growth in Asia
Key quote: We need to enhance the inclusiveness of Asia's economic growth, and financial inclusion can play an important role in tackling the stubborn poverty problem.
Rationale: The speech focuses on inclusive economic growth in Asia and financial inclusion, with no direct mention of monetary policy or interest rates. Thus, it is not related to current central bank policy decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Artificial intelligence (AI) and the frontiers of finance
Key quote: Today's conference focuses on the overlapping areas of new information technology, such as artificial intelligence (AI) and financial services, which now constitute the frontier of finance.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the role of AI and big data in finance and does not discuss monetary policy or interest rate changes, making it not directly related to monetary policy.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: A next growth model for Asian economy - beyond "the workshop of the world"
Key quote: Whatever the next growth model is, it is necessary for Asian economic growth to keep the free trade system.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the economic growth model for Asian countries and the significance of service sectors rather than addressing monetary policy or interest rates, hence it's categorized as 'Not related'. The prediction to 'Hold' with moderate probability takes into account the potential macroeconomic implications of the speech, though no direct monetary policy stance is expressed.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Digital innovation and FinTech
Key quote: I believe that policymakers should try to maximize the benefits and minimize the negative sides of technological innovation.
Rationale: The speech by Mr. Haruhiko Kuroda primarily focuses on digital innovation and its implications for the financial sector, particularly FinTech, but lacks any direct discussion on monetary policy, interest rates, or economic conditions that would influence rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: New challenges for Japan's labor market
Key quote: Finally, though there is regretfully no time to talk about monetary policy, I can only say that the structural reforms including labor market reform accompanied by the current easy monetary policy will contribute to sustainable development of Japan's economy.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on labor market challenges rather than directly evaluating monetary policy. The final note suggests existing monetary policy (easy monetary policy) will aid in economic stability, so there is no indication of an immediate rate change.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Information technology and financial services - the central bank's perspective
Key quote: FinTech has various implications for central banking. FinTech has a wide influence on payments, settlements and financial services, and could stimulate various economic activities, including e-commerce and 'sharing economy' businesses.
Rationale: The speech primarily discusses the impact of information technology and FinTech on financial services, rather than addressing specific monetary policy actions or economic conditions that would indicate a stance on interest rate decisions.

author: Haruhiko Kuroda
title: Innovations in payments and FinTech - the central bank's perspective
Key quote: From the standpoint of a central bank, the Bank is monitoring closely and with great interest the developments in innovations in payments and payment and settlement systems.
Rationale: Governor Kuroda's speech primarily discusses innovations in payment systems and FinTech, without addressing monetary policy or interest rates directly. Thus, it is categorized as 'Not related' to monetary policy.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Climate change and finance
Key quote: Today, I would like to talk about climate change and finance.
Rationale: The speech is focused on the impact of climate change on finance and the economy, particularly on the roles and responsibilities of financial institutions and central banks. It does not discuss monetary policy decisions or interest rates directly, hence it is categorized as 'Not related'.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: LIBOR transition in the final stage - there will be no Deus ex Machina
Key quote: There will be no deus ex machina by any means.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the LIBOR transition rather than monetary policy or changes in interest rates. Therefore, it is not related to central banking policy decisions regarding interest rates.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Central Bank Digital Currency and the future of payment and settlement systems
Key quote: The central bank needs to deepen the understanding of the benefits as well as the challenges and risks of issuing CBDC.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the future of payment systems and Central Bank Digital Currency (CBDC), rather than monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Financial literacy - money management for creating a life of well-being
Key quote: Today, I would like to talk about financial literacy.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial literacy and its importance, particularly in the context of an aging society. It does not address monetary policy or the central bank's policy rate, hence it is not related to the categories provided.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Interest rate benchmark reform in Japan
Key quote: It is my pleasure to have the opportunity to speak to you today about the interest rate benchmark reform.
Rationale: This speech is primarily about the reform of interest rate benchmarks like LIBOR and does not directly address monetary policy or central bank interest rates.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Development of Asia's capital markets - roles and challenges
Key quote: Asia needs to further accelerate and deepen the development of its financial markets more than ever before.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the development of Asia's capital markets and their implications for economic growth and stability, rather than directly addressing monetary policy stances or the Bank of Japan's interest rate decisions.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Should the Bank of Japan issue a digital currency?
Key quote: Many central banks therefore take the position that they have no plan to issue CBDCs in the near future but will continue research into CBDCs, which is the position the Bank of Japan also takes.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the exploration and research into digital currencies without indicating any immediate change in monetary policy or interest rates, suggesting a balanced view on the topic.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Opening remarks - G20 Symposium
Key quote: Aging is a common policy challenge for all G20 members.
Rationale: The speech focuses on demographic changes and their impact on the macro economy, fiscal conditions, and social security systems rather than directly addressing monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: The future of money
Key quote: The Bank of Japan does not have a plan to issue its own digital currency that can be widely used for payments and settlements at this juncture.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the future of money, IT innovation, digitization, and central bank digital currencies, but it does not indicate any immediate changes in monetary policy or rate adjustments.

author: Masayoshi Amamiya
title: Central banking in the digital age
Key quote: Although the Bank of Japan does not have a plan to issue its own digital currency at this juncture, the Bank fully acknowledges the importance of deeply understanding innovative technologies.
Rationale: The speech primarily focuses on the impact of IT innovation on financial systems, cybersecurity, and the potential for central bank digital currencies. It doesn't discuss current monetary policy stances or provide guidance on interest rates.

author: Masazumi Wakatabe
title: Financial and settlement systems as social infrastructure - disaster management perspective
Key quote: The theme of this symposium is 'The Impact of Natural Disasters on Financial Markets and Financial Institutions.'
Rationale: The speech mainly discusses disaster management and the role of financial institutions in times of disaster, without addressing monetary policy or interest rates.

author: Makoto Sakurai
title: Economic activity, prices, and monetary policy in Japan
Key quote: The world trade volume, which had been sluggish, started to increase from the second half of 2016 and has seen an acceleration in the pace since the second half of 2017.
Rationale: The speech discusses balanced economic growth and increased trade volume without focusing on Japan-specific monetary policy adjustments, suggesting a neutrality in tone towards future policy changes.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: New frontier of macroprudential policy - addressing financial institutions' low profitability and intensified competition
Key quote: At present, Japan's financial system is maintaining stability, but I think that attention should be paid to the potential vulnerabilities.
Rationale: The speech is focused on financial stability and macroprudential concerns, not on immediate monetary actions or adjustments to interest rates. Therefore, it does not imply a shift in monetary policy direction, suggesting a 'Hold' stance.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: Big data - its impacts on economies, finance and central banking
Key quote: I think that big data has great potential to vitalize various economic activities, innovate financial services, and increase economic welfare, as long as data security is firmly secured.
Rationale: The speech focuses on the impacts of big data and technological advancements on the economy and financial services, rather than directly addressing monetary policy or central bank rate changes.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: Future of central bank payment and settlement systems under economic globalization and technological innovation
Key quote: Central bank payment and settlement systems are facing big changes amid the wave of economic globalization and innovation in information technology.
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on payment and settlement systems, technological changes, and globalization, rather than monetary policy. However, given the absence of any direct monetary policy signals, the most likely action would be to hold rates steady.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: FinTech - its impacts on finance, economies and central banking
Key quote: FinTech encourages us to think about the future of money and central banking.
Rationale: The speech discusses FinTech and its implications on finance and economics, rather than focusing on current monetary policy or interest rate decisions. Therefore, it's not directly related to central bank's interest rate decision-making.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: Central bank policy on financial market infrastructure
Key quote: The Bank is ready to mobilize all the policy tools available while paying attention to interactions among various players involved in FMIs, market dynamics and impacts of technological innovations.
Rationale: The speech focuses on financial market infrastructure and technological innovations rather than discussing monetary policy or interest rates, hence it is not directly related to traditional monetary policy stances.

author: Hiroshi Nakaso
title: Developing a global code of conduct for the foreign exchange market
Key quote: I firmly believe that the successful development of a single global code and greater adherence to it will reinforce the functioning of the foreign exchange market.
Rationale: This speech is focused on the development of a global code of conduct for the foreign exchange market and not directly related to monetary policy or interest rate decisions.

author: Hirohide Kouguchi
title: How Will Digitalization Change Japan's Financial Services and Economy?(Keynote Speech at the Workshop Hosted by the Center for Advanced Financial Technology, Bank of Japan)
Key quote: NA
Rationale: The speech is primarily focused on the impact of digitalization on Japan's financial services and economy. While it mentions financial stability, it lacks specific references to monetary policy direction, thus marking it as not directly related to central bank interest rate decisions.
